template","slug":"how-to-use-this-template"},{"id":"ef3bae7255784ea79926c58a82a47af1","title":"faqs","slug":"faqs"},{"id":"24d5bef3dd05440ba05f3f7db0562b9d","title":"access","slug":"access"},{"id":"bffd3f57e6274e67bb916897ec2b8a3c","title":"language-access","slug":"language-access"}],"layout":{"sections":[{"containment":"fixed","isFooter":false,"style":{"background":{"isFile":true,"isUrl":false,"state":"valid","display":{},"transparency":0,"position":{"x":"center","y":"center"},"color":"#2b3639","image":"https://arcgishub.maps.arcgis.com/sharing/rest/content/items/cf2e660cd39347eea951c990718fd8a3/resources/coronavirus-header.jpeg","parallax":false,"fileSrc":"NEW-WEBSITE.jpg","cropSrc":"NEW-WEBSITE.jpg","cropId":"ic2vcvhqg"},"color":"#ffffff","rowLayout":"box"},"rows":[{"cards":[{"component":{"name":"markdown-card","settings":{"markdown":"

","schemaVersion":1}},"width":12,"showEditor":false}]}]},{"containment":"fixed","isFooter":false,"style":{"background":{"isFile":false,"isUrl":true,"state":"","display":{},"transparency":0,"position":{"x":"center","y":"center"},"color":"#2695bc","image":""},"color":"#ffffff","rowLayout":"box"},"rows":[{"cards":[{"component":{"name":"markdown-card","settings":{"markdown":"
COVID-19


COVID-19 is the infectious disease caused by the novel coronavirus. This new virus and disease were unknown to the population before the outbreak began in Wuhan, China, in December 2019. This page provides information, maps, and resources about the coronavirus response in our local area.


View the latest updates from Governor Kim Reynolds.



View COVID-19 information in multiple languages at the Iowa Dept. of Human Rights website. Call 877.558.2609 for the Iowa Multilingual COVID-19 Phone Line.


Visit the Internal Revenue Service (IRS) website for information on Economic Impact Payments (stimulus payments).","schemaVersion":1}},"width":12,"showEditor":false}]}]},{"containment":"fixed","isFooter":false,"style":{"background":{"isFile":false,"isUrl":true,"state":"","display":{},"transparency":0,"position":{"x":"center","y":"center"},"color":"#ffffff"},"color":"#aN","rowLayout":"box"},"rows":[{"cards":[{"component":{"name":"markdown-card","settings":{"markdown":"Current Status

Current Status
Accessibility Status Page

","schemaVersion":1}},"width":12}]},{"cards":[{"component":{"name":"markdown-card","settings":{"markdown":"","schemaVersion":1}},"width":1},{"component":{"name":"iframe-card","settings":{"src":"https://public.tableau.com/views/IowaCOVID19/CurrentStatus?iframeSizedToWindow=true&:embed=y&:showAppBanner=false&:display_count=no&:showVizHome=no&:render=false ","height":"800","scrollable":true,"title":"Tableau Dashboard"}},"width":10},{"component":{"name":"markdown-card","settings":{"markdown":"","schemaVersion":1}},"width":1}]}]},{"containment":"fixed","isFooter":false,"style":{"background":{"isFile":false,"isUrl":true,"state":"","display":{},"transparency":0,"position":{"x":"center","y":"center"},"color":"#eeeeee"},"rowLayout":"box"},"rows":[{"cards":[{"component":{"name":"markdown-card","settings":{"markdown":"Symptoms



Symptoms

Reported illnesses have ranged from mild symptoms to severe illness and death for confirmed coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) cases. The following symptoms may appear 2-14 days after exposure (based on previous MERS-CoV virus incubation periods).
Source- CDC
","schemaVersion":1}},"width":12}]},{"cards":[{"component":{"name":"image-card","settings":{"src":"https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/images/symptoms-cough.jpg","fileSrc":"","cropSrc":"","alt":"Cough with illustration of person wiping their nose","caption":"","captionAlign":"center","hyperlink":"","hyperlinkTabOption":"new","isUrl":true,"isFile":false,"state":"valid","display":{"position":{"x":"center","y":"center"},"reflow":false}}},"width":4},{"component":{"name":"image-card","settings":{"src":"https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/images/symptoms-fever.jpg","fileSrc":"","cropSrc":"","alt":"Fever with illustration of man sweating and holding thermometer","caption":"","captionAlign":"center","hyperlink":"","hyperlinkTabOption":"new","isUrl":true,"isFile":false,"state":"valid","display":{"position":{"x":"center","y":"center"},"reflow":false}}},"width":4},{"component":{"name":"image-card","settings":{"src":"https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/images/symptoms-shortness-breath.jpg","fileSrc":"","cropSrc":"","alt":"Shortness of Breath with illustration of person struggling to breathe","caption":"","captionAlign":"center","hyperlink":"","hyperlinkTabOption":"new","isUrl":true,"isFile":false,"state":"valid","display":{"position":{"x":"center","y":"center"},"reflow":false}}},"width":4}]},{"cards":[{"component":{"name":"markdown-card","settings":{"markdown":"
Call your doctor if you develop symptoms and have been in close contact with a person known to have COVID-19, or have recently traveled from an area with widespread/ongoing community spread of COVID-19.","schemaVersion":1}},"width":12}]}]},{"containment":"fixed","isFooter":false,"style":{"background":{"isFile":false,"isUrl":true,"state":"","display":{},"transparency":0,"position":{"x":"center","y":"center"},"color":"#ffffff"},"color":"#000000","rowLayout":"box"},"rows":[{"cards":[{"component":{"name":"markdown-card","settings":{"markdown":"hidden prevention

What You Can Do to Prevent Illness


There is currently no vaccine to prevent coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19). The best way to prevent illness is to avoid being exposed to this virus.

The virus is thought to spread mainly from person-to-person:
Between people who are in close contact with one another (within about 6 feet).
Through respiratory droplets produced when an infected person coughs or sneezes. These droplets can land in the mouths or noses of people who are nearby or possibly be inhaled into the lungs.
It may be possible that a person can get COVID-19 by touching a surface or object that has the virus on it and then touching their own mouth, nose, or possibly their eyes, but this is not thought to be the main way the virus spreads.","schemaVersion":1}},"width":8,"showEditor":false},{"component":{"name":"markdown-card","settings":{"markdown":"
Older adults and people who have severe underlying chronic medical conditions like heart or lung disease or diabetes seem to be at higher risk for developing more serious complications from COVID-19 illness.
Please consult with your health care provider about additional steps you may be able to take to protect yourself.
","schemaVersion":1}},"width":4}]},{"cards":[{"component":{"name":"markdown-card","settings":{"markdown":"
Take Steps to Protect Yourself and Others","schemaVersion":1}},"width":12}]},{"cards":[{"component":{"name":"markdown-card","settings":{"markdown":"
Clean your hands often



Wash your hands often with soap and water for at least 20 seconds especially after you have been in a public place, or after blowing your nose, coughing, or sneezing. If soap and water are not readily available, use a hand sanitizer that contains at least 60% alcohol.
Avoid touching your eyes, nose, and mouth with unwashed hands.


","schemaVersion":1}},"width":4},{"component":{"name":"markdown-card","settings":{"markdown":"
Avoid close contact
Avoid close contact with people who are sick
Put distance between yourself and other people if COVID-19 is spreading in your community. This is especially important for people who are at higher risk of getting very sick.","schemaVersion":1}},"width":4},{"component":{"name":"markdown-card","settings":{"markdown":"
Stay home if you're sick
Stay home if you are sick, except to get medical care. Learn what to do if you are sick.
","schemaVersion":1}},"width":4}]},{"cards":[{"component":{"name":"markdown-card","settings":{"markdown":"
Cover coughs/sneezes

Cover your mouth and nose with a tissue when you cough or sneeze or use the inside of your elbow.
Throw used tissues in the trash.
Immediately wash your hands with soap and water for at least 20 seconds. If soap and water are not readily available, clean your hands with a hand sanitizer that contains at least 60% alcohol.","schemaVersion":1}},"width":4},{"component":{"name":"markdown-card","settings":{"markdown":"
Know how it spreads

There is currently no vaccine to prevent coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19).
The best way to prevent illness is to avoid being exposed to this virus.
The virus is thought to spread mainly from person-to-person. It can spread between people who are in close contact with one another (within about 6 feet) or through respiratory droplets produced when an infected person coughs or sneezes.
These droplets can land in the mouths or noses of people who are nearby or possibly be inhaled into the lungs.","schemaVersion":1}},"width":4},{"component":{"name":"markdown-card","settings":{"markdown":"
Clean and disinfect
Clean AND disinfect frequently touched surfaces daily. This includes tables, doorknobs, light switches, countertops, handles, desks, phones, keyboards, toilets, faucets, and sinks.
If surfaces are dirty, clean them: Use detergent or soap and water prior to disinfection.
Complete disinfection guidance can be found here","schemaVersion":1}},"width":4}]}]},{"containment":"fixed","isFooter":false,"style":{"background":{"isFile":false,"isUrl":true,"state":"","display":{},"transparency":0,"position":{"x":"center","y":"center"},"color":"#eeeeee"},"rowLayout":"box"},"rows":[{"cards":[{"component":{"name":"markdown-card","settings":{"markdown":"
What to do if you are sick
See all steps from the CDC here.","schemaVersion":1}},"width":6,"showEditor":false},{"component":{"name":"markdown-card","settings":{"markdown":"
Call your doctor: If you think you have been exposed to COVID-19 and develop a fever and symptoms of respiratory illness, such as cough or difficulty breathing, call your healthcare provider immediately.","schemaVersion":1}},"width":6}]},{"cards":[{"component":{"name":"markdown-card","settings":{"markdown":"





Stay Home except to get medical care


 
 






Separate yourself from other people and animals in your home


 
 






Call ahead before visiting a doctor

.
 
 






Cover your coughs and clean your hands often


 
 




","schemaVersion":1}},"width":12,"showEditor":false}]},{"cards":[{"component":{"name":"markdown-card","settings":{"markdown":"
View CDC resources in languages other than English.
Go to CDC site","schemaVersion":1}},"width":12}]}]},{"containment":"fixed","isFooter":false,"style":{"background":{"isFile":false,"isUrl":true,"state":"","display":{},"transparency":0,"position":{"x":"center","y":"center"},"color":"#2695bc"},"rowLayout":"box","color":"#ffffff"},"rows":[{"cards":[{"component":{"name":"markdown-card","settings":{"markdown":"Proclamations

COVID-19 Proclamations
","schemaVersion":1}},"width":12}]},{"cards":[{"component":{"name":"image-card","settings":{"src":"","fileSrc":"new-iowa-proclamations.png","cropSrc":"new-iowa-proclamations.png","alt":"Illustration of State of Iowa shape with proclamation document","caption":"","captionAlign":"center","hyperlink":"","hyperlinkTabOption":"new","isUrl":false,"isFile":true,"state":"valid","display":{"position":{"x":"center","y":"center"},"reflow":false}}},"width":6},{"component":{"name":"markdown-card","settings":{"markdown":"
Governor's Disaster Proclamations
State resources have been activated and deployed to assist with the ongoing disaster at no cost to local jurisdictions. State resources include equipment, personnel, technical assistance/guidance, supplies, and essential services to provide assistance in the form of traffic control, security, vaccines, transportation, and other emergency response and recovery capabilities.


Iowa's COVID-19 Disaster Proclamations



Proclamation of Disaster Emergency signed 04/16
 
 


Proclamation of Disaster Emergency signed 04/10
 
 


Proclamation of Disaster Emergency signed 04/06
 
 



Proclamation of Disaster Emergency signed 04/02
 
 



Proclamation of Disaster Emergency signed 03/31
 
 




Proclamation of Disaster Emergency signed 03/26
 
 



Proclamation of Disaster Emergency signed 03/22
 
 



Proclamation of Disaster Emergency signed 03/19
 
 



Proclamation of Disaster Emergency signed 03/17
 
 



Proclamation of Disaster Emergency signed 03/13
 
 



Proclamation of Disaster Emergency signed 03/09
 

","schemaVersion":1}},"width":6}]},{"cards":[{"component":{"name":"markdown-card","settings":{"markdown":"","schemaVersion":1}},"width":12}]},{"cards":[{"component":{"name":"image-card","settings":{"src":"","fileSrc":"pres-proclamations.png","cropSrc":"pres-proclamations.png","alt":"Illustration of United States with illustration of White House","caption":"","captionAlign":"center","hyperlink":"","hyperlinkTabOption":"new","isUrl":false,"isFile":true,"state":"valid","display":{"position":{"x":"center","y":"center"},"reflow":false}}},"width":6},{"component":{"name":"markdown-card","settings":{"markdown":"
Presidential Major Disaster Declaration The president approved Gov. Kim Reynolds' request for a Presidential Major Disaster Declaration for COVID-19, removing a $5 million cap on federal funds as well as making available the Community Disaster Loan program. The declaration provides assistance for work and services to save lives and protect property, to include emergency protective measures.

 
 
 



Governor's Press Release on 03/23 Declaration
 



White House Press Release on 03/23 Declaration
 



FEMA Information on 03/23 Declaration

 
 
 ","schemaVersion":1}},"width":6}]}]},{"containment":"fixed","isFooter":false,"style":{"background":{"isFile":false,"isUrl":true,"state":"","display":{},"transparency":0,"position":{"x":"center","y":"center"},"color":"#aN"},"rowLayout":"box"},"rows":[{"cards":[{"component":{"name":"markdown-card","settings":{"markdown":"Guidance

","headerType":"custom","showLogo":true,"showTitle":true,"logo":{"display":{},"state":"valid","vertical":false,"isFile":true,"isUrl":false,"fileSrc":"iowa.png","cropSrc":"iowa.png"},"shortTitle":"Coronavirus","menuLinks":[],"socialLinks":{"facebook":{"visible":false,"url":"https://www.esri.com/en-us/disaster-response/overview"},"twitter":{"visible":false,"url":"https://twitter.com/"},"instagram":{}},"schemaVersion":2,"alt":"state of iowa logo"}},"showEditor":false},"footer":{"component":{"name":"site-footer","settings":{"footerType":"custom","markdown":"

","schemaVersion":1}},"showEditor":false}},"theme":{"header":{"background":"#2694bb","text":"#ffffff"},"body":{"background":"#fff","text":"#292929","link":"#043445"},"button":{"background":"#ebebeb","text":"#ffffff"},"logo":{"small":"https://disasterresponse.maps.arcgis.com/sharing/rest/content/items/0d189ae6c72d4c8e9e1d6ba33977bef4/data"},"fonts":{"base":{"url":"","family":"Avenir Next"},"heading":{"url":"","family":"Avenir Next"}},"globalNav":{"background":"#2f5e8c","text":"#ffffff"}},"headerSass":".custom-header {
 .first-tier {
 height: 40px;
 margin-bottom: 0px;
 background-color: #000000;
 }

 .first-tier .nav>li>a {
 margin-top: 5px;
 padding: 3px 6px;
 color: #fff;
 }

 .first-tier .nav>li>a:focus,
 .first-tier .nav>li>a:hover {
 background-color: #136fbf;
 color: #fff;
 }

 .first-tier .site-logo img {
 vertical-align: middle;
 }

 .first-tier h1 {
 display: inline;
 font-size: 25px;
 }

 .second-tier {
 margin-bottom: 0px;
 background-color: #05466c;
 } 

 .site-header .navbar-header img {
 vertical-align: middle;
 height: 50px;
 padding: 5px;
 }

 .header-container {
 top: 40px;
 margin: 0 auto;
 max-width: 1440px;
 position: absolute;
 width: 100%;
 transform: translateX(-50%);
 left: 50%;
 z-index: 10;
 transition: max-width 250ms linear;
 } 

 .header-container .navbar .container-fluid {
 display: flex;
 }

 .header-container .navbar.navbar-default {
 background-color: #fff;
 border-color: transparent !important;
 border-radius: 0;
 }

 .header-container .navbar.navbar-default .navbar-collapse.collapse {
 display: flex !important;
 flex: 1;
 padding-right: 0;
 }

 .header-container .navbar.navbar-default .navbar-brand {
 color: #333;
 height: auto;
 padding: 1rem;
 }

 .header-container .navbar.navbar-default .navbar-brand-img {
 display: inline-block;
 }

 .header-container .navbar.navbar-default .navbar-nav {
 flex: 2;
 align-items: center;
 justify-content: center;
 margin: auto;
 float: none;
 }

 .header-container .navbar.navbar-default .navbar-nav>li {
 float: none;
 display: inline-block;
 }

 .header-container .navbar.navbar-default .navbar-nav>li>a {
 background: transparent;
 color: #333;
 font-size: 15px;
 transition: all 250ms linear;
 }

 .header-container .navbar.navbar-default .navbar-nav>li>a:focus,
 .header-container .navbar.navbar-default .navbar-nav>li>a:hover {
 background: #3276AE;
 color: #fff;
 }

 .header-container .navbar.navbar-default .navbar-right {
 margin-right: 0;
 flex: 1;
 text-align: right;
 }

 .is-sticky {
 position: relative;
 z-index: 10;
 }

 .is-sticky .header-container {
 max-width: 100%;
 }

 @media screen and (max-width: 768px) {
 .header-container .navbar-header {
 width: 100%;
 }
 .header-container .navbar-default .navbar-toggle {
 margin-top: 18px;
 }
 .header-container .navbar .container-fluid {
 display: block !important;
 }
 .header-container .navbar.navbar-default .navbar-collapse.collapse {
 overflow: hidden;
 display: none !important;
 }
 .header-container .navbar.navbar-default .navbar-collapse.collapse.in {
 display: block !important;
 }
 .header-container .navbar.navbar-default .navbar-nav {
 display: inherit;
 padding: 0 0 1rem 0;
 }
 .header-container .navbar.navbar-default .navbar-nav > li {
 display: block;
 }
 }

/* Editor adjustment for absolute positioned header */
 header ~ .body-editor section:first-child { padding-top: 100px;}

 }","footerSass":".custom-footer {

}","defaultHostname":"coronavirus-response-iowa.hub.arcgis.com","subdomain":"coronavirus-response","updatedAt":"2020-04-21T21:27:31.931Z","updatedBy":"IowaHSEMD_iowa","capabilities":["pages","my_data","social_logins","json_chart_card","document_iframes","items_view","app_page"],"clientId":"k3HwjY5jXQrW7q5w","siteId":"","customHostname":"coronavirus.iowa.gov","externalUrl":"coronavirus.iowa.gov"},"catalog":{"groups":["a982006ec8b0438a81ffb247749c5248"]},"source":"be2f171c60464c28937df5ee877d385f"},"domainInfo":{"id":"48254","domain":"coronavirus.iowa.gov","hostname":"coronavirus.iowa.gov","siteId":"d83ad06141fe4acd9a0461020f9d9d8e","clientKey":"k3HwjY5jXQrW7q5w","orgKey":"iowa","siteTitle":"Iowa Coronavirus Information","orgId":"vPD5PVLI6sfkZ5E4","orgTitle":"State of Iowa","createdAt":"2020-03-17T18:28:08Z","updatedAt":"2020-03-17T18:28:08Z","sslOnly":true,"permanentRedirect":false},"injected":true,"status":200},"status":200}
